perturbation.original_text: The Company shall provide the Repairer not later than the tenth (10t h) Day of each Month with an activity report relating to each Aircraft and each Main Element serial number, and containing at least FH and Cycles performed during the preceding Month, the TSN, CSN, TSO, CSO, and the removals/installations events during such Month; and,
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall provide the Repairer not later than the twenty-fifth (25th) Day of each Month with an activity report relating to each Aircraft and each Main Element serial number, and containing at least FH and Cycles performed during the preceding Month, the TSN, CSN, TSO, CSO, and the removals/installations events during such Month; and,
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the reporting deadline from the 10th to the 25th of each month may violate laws in Brazil that mandate timely financial reporting and tax compliance. Brazilian regulations often require businesses to submit financial data and pay taxes within specific deadlines, typically within the first 10-20 days of the month. Delaying the report submission could lead to non-compliance with tax and regulatory obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian tax and financial reporting regulations (e.g., requirements set by the Receita Federal do Brasil)

perturbation.original_text:
Unless otherwise set out herein, the Company shall pay all invoices issued by the Repairer pursuant to this Agreement, as follows:
     (i) within thirty (30) Days from the date of issuance of the Repairer's invoice; and,
perturbation.changed_text:
Unless otherwise set out herein, the Company shall pay all invoices issued by the Repairer pursuant to this Agreement, as follows:
     (i) within ninety (90) Days from the date of issuance of the Repairer's invoice; and,
perturbation.explanation: Extending the payment term to 90 days contradicts Law 8.137/90 in Brazil, which aims to protect creditors by establishing a 30-day default payment term. This delay may cause financial damage to the Repairer and violates established commercial protection laws.

perturbation.original_text: Invoice dispute: any invoice disputed by the Company shall have to be issued by Notice duly documented to the Repairer within [*****] from the date of its issuance. For the sake of clarity, the undisputed portion of such invoice shall be paid pursuant to this Agreement. Any invoice not disputed by the Company within said [*****] period, shall be deemed to be accepted by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Invoice dispute: any invoice disputed by the Company shall have to be issued by Notice duly documented to the Repairer within sixty (60) days from the date of its issuance. For the sake of clarity, the undisputed portion of such invoice shall be paid pursuant to this Agreement. Any invoice not disputed by the Company within said sixty (60) days period, shall be deemed to be accepted by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: By setting the invoice dispute period to 60 days, this will contravene Brazilian Finance Laws, which require dispute resolutions within a shorter timeframe. Most likely to violate Brazilian Civil Code requirements for billing disputes (usually 30 days).
